Title: Three Approaches to Detecting Discrete Integrability
Abstract: © 2019, The Author(s).A class of discrete equations is considered from three perspectives corresponding to three measures of complexity of the solutions: the (hyper-) order of meromorphic solutions in the sense of Nevanlinna, the degree growth of iterates over a function field and the height growth of iterates over the rational numbers. In each case, low complexity implies a form of singularity confinement which results in a known discrete Painlevé equation.
